title: Authors and Citation
text: Thomas Delclite. Author, maintainer. Adrien Mierop. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Delclite T, Mierop (2025). vizsurvey: Visualisation Analysis Survey Field. R package version 0.1.0, https://github.com/tdelc/vizsurvey.
code: @Manual{,   title = {vizsurvey: Visualisation And Analysis During a Survey Field},   author = {Thomas Delclite and Adrien Mierop},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://github.com/tdelc/vizsurvey}, }

what: Visualisation And Analysis During a Survey Field
title: Visualisation And Analysis During a Survey Field
text: vizsurvey R package designed streamline quality assessment survey data providing intuitive visual diagnostics interactive dashboard. takes input survey database containing annual quarterly data, enriched interviewer-specific variables wide array survey variables. package outputs user-friendly dashboard highlights anomalies—defined deviations expected norms—either year interviewer. central feature tool heatmap visualization, allows users quickly detect patterns irregularities across interviewers variables, helping identify potential data quality issues interviewer effects. vizsurvey especially useful institutions researchers conducting large-scale surveys multiple interviewers, enabling fast systematic overview data quality time.

title: Visualisation And Analysis During a Survey Field
text: can install development version vizsurvey like :

title: Visualisation And Analysis During a Survey Field
code: library(vizsurvey)  # vizsurvey_dashboard() # To be created  # OR  # vizsurvey_dashboard("link") # Link to your data, # To be created

title: Create a heatmap — heat_map_group
Create a heatmap — heat_map_group
code: library(laeken) data(eusilc)  info_vars <- classify_variables(eusilc) vars_vd <- info_vars[info_vars$type == "Modal", ]$variable vars_vc <- info_vars[info_vars$type == "Continuous", ]$variable db_stats <- prepa_stats(eusilc, vars_vd, vars_vc, "db040") heat_map_group(db_stats, 5)

title: Create a summarise of all the difference — prepa_stats
Create a summarise of all the difference — prepa_stats
code: library(laeken) data(eusilc)  info_vars <- classify_variables(eusilc) vars_vd <- info_vars[info_vars$type == "Modal", ]$variable vars_vc <- info_vars[info_vars$type == "Continuous", ]$variable prepa_stats(eusilc, vars_vd, vars_vc, "db040") #> # A tibble: 972 × 9 #>    db040      variable  Nrow  Nval type  stat      value value_ref standard #>    <chr>      <chr>    <int> <dbl> <chr> <chr>     <dbl>     <dbl>    <dbl> #>  1 Burgenland hsize      549   549 cha   missing   0         0        0     #>  2 Burgenland hsize      549   549 cha   presence  1         1        0     #>  3 Burgenland hsize      549   549 cha   Nmod      6         7.89    -2.04  #>  4 Burgenland hsize      549   549 cha   chi2     37.3      67.3     -0.234 #>  5 Burgenland pb220a     549   476 cha   missing   0.133     0.184   -1.28  #>  6 Burgenland pb220a     549   476 cha   presence  1         1        0     #>  7 Burgenland pb220a     549   476 cha   Nmod      4         4        0     #>  8 Burgenland pb220a     549   476 cha   chi2     30.6      35.7      0     #>  9 Burgenland pl030      549   476 cha   missing   0.133     0.184   -1.28  #> 10 Burgenland pl030      549   476 cha   presence  1         1        0     #> # ℹ 962 more rows
